API reference¶

class asteramisk.ui.voice_ui.VoiceUI(channel, voice='en-US-Neural2-J')[source]¶

Bases: UI

A voice user interface for Asterisk Provides methods such as answer(), hangup(), say(), ask_yes_no(), prompt(), and gather() API should be the same as the base UI class and any other UI subclasses (TextUI, etc.)

async answer()[source]¶

Answers the call

async ask_yes_no(text) → bool[source]¶

Ask the user a yes/no question :param text: Text to prompt the user :return: True if the user answers yes or False if the user answers no

async gather(text, num_digits) → str[source]¶

Prompt the user for dtmf input :param text: Text to prompt the user :return: The user’s input

async hangup()[source]¶

Hangs up the call

async play(filename) → None[source]¶

Play file :param filename: Name of the file to play, without the extension File must be in asterisk sounds directory e.g. “recordings/recording”. :raise GoBackException: If the user presses * :raise GoToMainException: If the user presses #

async prompt(text) → str[source]¶

Prompt the user for input :param text: Text to prompt the user :return: The user’s input

async record(prompt=None, filename=None, timeout=10000, playbeep=True, silence=2500)[source]¶

Record audio :param prompt: Text to prompt :param filename: Name of the file to save recording to, if None a random name will be generated. Only the name, not the extension or path :param timeout: Maximum length of recording in milliseconds :param playbeep: Play a beep before recording :param silence: Milliseconds of silence before recording is stopped :return: Full path to the saved file

async say(text) → None[source]¶

Speak text to the user :param text: Text to speak :raise: GoBackException: if the user presses * :raise: GotoMainException: if the user presses #

async send_command(command)[source]¶

Sends an AGI command to Asterisk :param: command: Command to send :return: dict: Result of the AGI command

class asteramisk.communicator.Communicator(callerid_number=None, callerid_name='Default')[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for making calls and text message conversations.

Example usage:

communicator = await Communicator.create()
try:
    await communicator.make_call(recipient_number="1234567890")
    await communicator.send_message(recipient_number="1234567890", message="Hello world!")
    await communicator.send_receive(recipient_number="1234567890", message="Hello world!")
finally:
    await communicator.close()

Can be used as a context manager.

async with Communicator.create() as communicator:
    await communicator.make_call(recipient_number="1234567890")
    await communicator.send_message(recipient_number="1234567890", message="Hello world!")
async close()[source]¶
async connect()[source]¶
async classmethod create(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
async make_call(recipient_number=None, channel=None, application='AGI', data='agi:async', callerid_number=None, callerid_name=None) → VoiceUI[source]¶

Makes a call to the recipient and returns a VoiceUI object. :param recipient_number: The number to call. Uses PJSIP with voip.ms :type recipient_number: str :param channel: The channel to dial for the call. Mutually exclusive with recipient_number :type channel: str :param application: The application to execute at our end of the call. :type application: str :param data: The data to pass to the application. :type data: str :param callerid_number: The number to use for the caller ID. :type callerid_number: str :param callerid_name: The name to use for the caller ID. :type callerid_name: str :return: An asteramisk.ui.VoiceUI object. :rtype: asteramisk.ui.VoiceUI :raises ValueError: If neither recipient_number or channel is provided or both are provided :raises asteramisk.exceptions.CallFailedException: If the call fails

async make_conversation(recipient_number=None, callerid_number=None, callerid_name='Default', contact_method=None) → VoiceUI | TextUI[source]¶

Starts a new messaging conversation with the recipient. :param recipient_number: The number to contact. :type recipient_number: str :param callerid_number: The number to use for the caller ID. :type callerid_number: str :param callerid_name: The name to use for the caller ID. :type callerid_name: str :param contact_method: The contact method to use. Either “call” or “text” :type contact_method: str :return: An asteramisk.ui.VoiceUI or asteramisk.ui.TextUI object. :rtype: Union[asteramisk.ui.VoiceUI, asteramisk.ui.TextUI]

async make_text(recipient_number=None, callerid_number=None, callerid_name='Default') → TextUI[source]¶

Starts a new messaging conversation with the recipient. :param recipient_number: The number to message. :type recipient_number: str :param callerid_number: The number to use for the caller ID. :type callerid_number: str :param callerid_name: The name to use for the caller ID. :type callerid_name: str :return: An asteramisk.ui.TextUI object. :rtype: asteramisk.ui.TextUI
